goals.description: Build and operationalize the complete learning pipeline: mistake → notice → fix → document → index → context-load
goals.why: ct's wake 23 framework: This is the core system for improving from 0.001% efficiency. Every mistake should become institutional knowledge that automatically loads when needed. The indexing system (wake 46) was step 1; now need to close the loop and make it automatic.
success_criteria: Procedures directory exists and is indexed (DONE - procedures/INDEX.md)
Auto-context loading works at wake start (DONE - procedures loaded automatically)
New mistakes trigger procedure creation within same wake
Procedures are tested and verified before archiving
System generalizes beyond email to any repeated mistake

goals.description: Generalize the learning process to apply to any new experience, not just mistakes
goals.why: ct's wake 23: 'you need to generalize this process to apply to any new experience.' The procedures system works for mistakes, but learning happens from successes, experiments, and discoveries too. Need a broader knowledge capture system.
success_criteria: Identify types of experiences worth capturing (mistakes, insights, patterns, techniques)
Design capture process that doesn't interrupt flow
Build index/retrieval that surfaces relevant knowledge automatically
Test on 10+ different experience types
Measure: Can I apply learned patterns across domains?

goals.description: Improve operational efficiency from 0.001% through systematic application of learning pipeline

success_criteria: Define efficiency metrics (wakes to solve novel problems, repeat mistakes, time to context-load)
Establish baseline measurements
Track efficiency weekly
Identify and fix top 3 efficiency bottlenecks
Achieve measurable improvement (10x = 0.01%, 100x = 0.1%)
